All Classes

Class Description
Application
Application class acts as the main class which runs the program.
Board
The Board class is an integral part of the game system as it creates and assigns indexes to all the nodes.
BoardView
The BoardView class is a critical component of the application's front-end, responsible for rendering the game board using Java Swing.
Command
The Command class is an interface that enables the use of the Command design pattern in our system.
GameController
The Board and GameView of the game, as well as the processing of user interactions, are all managed by the GameController class.
GameState
The GameState class is an enumeration that stores constants used to indicate the current game state during each iteration.
GameStateMemento
This class applies the memento design pattern to store a snapshot of the game state at a specific point in time.
GameView
The GameView class is responsible for creating the user interface using Java Swing.
HumanPlayer
HumanPlayer will inherit the Player class.
JumpCommand
The JumpCommand class implements the Command interface and its main responsibility is to execute the jump token logic provided by the Player class.
MessageView
The MessageView class is a crucial component responsible for the front-end display of information using Java Swing.
MoveCommand
The MoveCommand class implements the Command interface and its main responsibility is to execute the move token logic provided by the Player class.
Node
Node class refers to the position on the board.
NodeTriplet
NodeTriplet is a class that is defined to have 3 nodes that appear in the same row in a set.
Observer
The observer class in Java defines an interface that serves as a blueprint for other classes to implement a set of required methods.
Player
The player is defined as an abstract class to provide abstraction.
RemoveCommand
The RemoveCommand class implements the Command interface and its main responsibility is to execute the remove token logic provided by the Player class.
SetCommand
The SetCommand class implements the Command interface and its main responsibility is to execute the set token logic provided by the Player class.
TokenColor
TokenColor is an enumeration of the color of the token.
